SEARCH
Package org.myshelfie.controller

Class LobbyController

java.lang.Object
org.myshelfie.controller.LobbyController
public class LobbyController extends Object
This class is the entry point of every command received by the server. It manages all the games and the lobbies, and forwards the commands to the right GameController.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static LobbyController getInstance(Server server)
      Returns the single instance of the LobbyController, implementing the Singleton pattern.
      Parameters:
      server - The server that will be used by the LobbyController
      Returns:
      The single instance of the LobbyController

    • executeCommand

      public void executeCommand(CommandMessage command, UserInputEvent t)
      Main execution method, called by Server.update(org.myshelfie.network.client.ClientRMIInterface, org.myshelfie.network.messages.commandMessages.CommandMessageWrapper). Makes the correct GameController execute the command. Send the update to all the interested clients. Check if the game has ended and delete it if so. Save the server status.
      Parameters:
      command - The command to execute
      t - The event that triggered the command

    • removeGameWhenFinished

      public static void removeGameWhenFinished(String gameName)

    • deleteGame

      public void deleteGame(String gameName)

    • getGames

      public List<GameController.GameDefinition> getGames()
      Returns the list of GameController.GameDefinition of all the available games.
      Returns:
      The list of available games

    • createGame

      public void createGame(CreateGameMessage message) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Executes the CreateGameCommand to create a new game, adds the player to the list of players inside the game and subscribes the client to the event listener to make it receive updates from that game.
      Parameters:
      message - The message containing the information to create the game
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the game cannot be created

    • joinGame

      public void joinGame(JoinGameMessage message) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Executes the JoinGameCommand to join an existing game, adds the player to the list of players inside the game and subscribes the client to the event listener to make it receive updates from that game. Then checks if the game has reached the maximum number of players and set it up if so.
      Parameters:
      message - The JoinGameMessage containing the name of the game to join and the nickname of the player
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the game is not found or not joinable

    • retrieveGame

      public Game retrieveGame(String gameName)

    • getGameNameFromPlayerNickname

      public String getGameNameFromPlayerNickname(String nickname)
      Returns the name of the game in which the player with that nickname is currently playing.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player.
      Returns:
      The name of the game in which the player with that nickname is currently playing.

    • handleClientDisconnection

      public void handleClientDisconnection(String nickname)
      Handles the disconnection of a client: it sets the player offline if the game has already started, whereas it removes it from the lobby if the game has not, but the player has already joined the lobby.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player that has disconnected.

    • handleClientReconnection

      public boolean handleClientReconnection(String nickname)
      Handles the reconnection of a client: if possible, it will add them back to the game, otherwise it will add them back to the lobby to which they were connected. If it is not possible to add the player back to the game, it will return false.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player that had disconnected.
